ee
explanation: Funds are available due to reduced requirement for Army background investigations sent externally to the National Background Investigations Bureau (NBIB). Funds can be realigned to support investigative activities at DSS and will produce the equivalent number of investigations benefit on behalf of the Army. This is not a MIP Project. This is base budget funding.

es co
explanation: Funds are required to procure a compact, powerful, software-defined radio transceiver system to provide the ability to detect, intercept and monitor advance civilian cellular technology. This software- defined radio technological advancement has the capacity for processing complex emerging protocols, such as Long-Term Evolution (LTE) and High Speed Packet Access (HSPA+). This is a new start. This is a MIP project. The total cost of this new start effort is $2.2 million. This is an OCO budget requirement.
Funds are required for a classified effort. Additional classified details will be provided under separate cover. This is a MIP project. This is an OCO budget requirement.

po eT
explanation: Funds are available due to technical issues being discovered with the electro-optical/infrared (EO/IR) turret during integration testing. Due to these technical issues, the program will purchase two less RQ-21 kits in FY 2019. This is a MIP project. This is Title X OCO budget funding.

Funds are required for Common Sensor Payload (CSP) retrofit of the remaining twenty-two (22) standard definition payloads to high definition payloads, thereby achieving full fleet high definition capability. High definition allows commanders to identify High Value Individual (HVJ) targets at sufficient standoff range, which directly supports the targeting process, and provides significantly enhanced situational awareness across the spectrum of combat operations. The FY 2019 budget request for six (6) battle damage replacement CSP systems, which was reduced by $11.4 million in the FY 2019 enactment, is a separate

Funds are available due to an Army decision to reduce the requirement for the acquisition of Cellular Exploitation Kits and Document Exploitation Kits for the Counter Intelligence and Human Intelligence Automated Reporting and Collection System (CHARCS). Funding is available for the higher priority Army requirements. This is a MIP project. This is Title IX OCO budget funding.
